alert.note: Alert for Essex (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 28 at 3:23PM EST until January 30 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 PM EST SATURDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM SATURDAY TO 1 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. * WHERE...Essex County. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 10 PM this evening to 1 PM EST Saturday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 1 PM Saturday to 1 AM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Wind chills this cold could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. Plan on slippery road conditions in the snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The lowest wind chills will occur between 3 AM and 9 AM Saturday morning. Snow will begin after the noon hour and be heaviest during the late afternoon and early evening before ending around midnight.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Please allow extra time if travel is necessary.
